isis.stitle: CF 500, CF 600 Wheels and Tires - Wheels and Tires - Removal and Installation

warning.para: Use only the integral 2-piece swiveling wheel nuts. Do not attempt to use cone-shaped 1-piece wheel nuts on these vehicles. If used, cone-shaped 1-piece wheel nuts can come loose in vehicle operation. Do not attempt to use past model wheels, which have cone-shaped wheel hub bolt nut seats, on this vehicle. Do not attempt to use present design wheels and wheel nuts on past model wheel hubs. Attempted use of intermixed wheels can lead to damage to the wheel mounting system and could result in wheels coming loose.

step1.para: Remove the wheel cover, if equipped.

caution.para: Do not use heat to loosen a seized wheel nut. Heat can damage the wheel and wheel bearings.

note.para: Do not remove the wheel nuts at this time.

step1.para: With the weight of the vehicle still on the tires, loosen the wheel nuts.
Raise the vehicle until the wheel and tire assembly clears the floor. For additional information, refer to Jacking and Lifting in S10019.
Remove the wheel nuts.
Remove the wheel and tire assembly.

warning.para: When a wheel is installed, always remove any corrosion, dirt or foreign material present on the mounting surfaces of the wheel, or the surface of the front disc brake hub and rotor, that contacts the wheel. Installing wheels without correct metal-to-metal contact at the wheel mounting surfaces can cause the wheel nuts to loosen and the wheel to come off while the vehicle is in motion, resulting in loss of control.

step1.para: Position the wheel and tire assembly on the vehicle.

caution.para: Do not apply motor oil to the wheel nut threads or the wheel stud threads.

step1.para: On all 2-piece flat wheel nuts, apply one drop of motor oil between the flat washer and the nut. If corrosion exists, or the integral 2-piece swiveling wheel nut does not rotate freely, install new swiveling wheel nuts as necessary.
• Install the wheel nuts loosely.
Turn the wheel until one wheel nut is at the top of the wheel hub bolt circle. Tighten the wheel nut until snug. Tighten the remaining wheel nuts, in the sequence shown, until snug.
Lower the vehicle.

caution.para: Failure to tighten the wheel nuts in the sequence shown can result in high wheel and tire runout, which will speed up the development of brake roughness, shudder and vibration.
Torque specifications are for nut and bolt threads that are free of dirt and rust. Use only International-recommended replacement fasteners.

step1.para: With the weight of the vehicle on the tires, tighten the wheel nuts to 210 Nm (155 lb-ft) in the sequence shown.
Install the wheel cover, if equipped.

Advise the customer that the wheel nuts need to be retightened at 800 km (500 miles) after wheel change or any other time the wheel nuts have been loosened. This is required to permit the wheel clamping system to seat correctly so that the wheel nuts will hold a uniform clamp load and remain fully tightened.

warning.para: Use only the integral 2-piece swiveling wheel nuts. Do not attempt to use cone-shaped 1-piece wheel nuts on these vehicles. If used, cone-shaped 1-piece wheel nuts can come loose in vehicle operation. Do not attempt to use past model wheels, which have cone-shaped wheel hub bolt nut seats, on this vehicle. Do not attempt to use present design wheels and wheel nuts on past model wheel hubs. Attempted use of intermixed wheels can lead to damage to the wheel mounting system and could result in wheels coming loose.

step1.para: Remove the wheel cover, if equipped.

caution.para: Do not use heat to loosen a seized wheel nut. Heat can damage the wheel and wheel bearings.

note.para: Do not remove the wheel nuts at this time.

step1.para: With the weight of the vehicle still on the tires, loosen the wheel nuts.
Raise and support the vehicle. For additional information, refer to Jacking and Lifting in S10019.
Remove the wheel nuts.
Remove the outer wheel and tire assembly.
Remove the inner wheel and tire assembly.

caution.para: On the chassis, it is imperative that the stamped indents located on the tire bead portion of the wheels are placed as close to 180 degrees from each other while still allowing access to the valve stem on the inside wheel. Failure to correctly install the wheel and tire assemblies can result in a vibration condition.

step1.para: Install the inner and outer wheel and tire assemblies.

calloutgroup.callout1: Position the inner wheel and tire assembly onto the axle.
Note the location of the alignment mark.
Position the outer wheel and tire assembly.
Position the alignment mark on the outer wheel and tire assembly as close to 180 degrees away from the alignment mark on the inner wheel and tire assembly.
The valve stem on the inner wheel and tire assembly must be aligned with one of the 5 hand holes in the outer wheel and tire assembly.
Install the wheel nuts hand-tight. Do not tighten the wheel nuts to specification at this time.

step1.para: Lower the vehicle.

caution.para: Failure to tighten the wheel nuts in the sequence shown can result in high wheel and tire runout, which will speed up the development of brake roughness, shudder and vibration.

step1.para: With the weight of the vehicle on the tires, tighten the wheel nuts in the sequence shown.

item.para: Tighten M14 wheel nuts to 210 Nm (155 lb-ft).
Tighten M22 wheel nuts to 624 Nm (460 lb-ft).

step1.para: Install the wheel cover, if equipped.

Advise the customer that the wheel nuts need to be retightened at 800 km (500 miles) after wheel change or any other time the wheel nuts have been loosened. This is required to permit the wheel clamping system to seat correctly so that the wheel nuts will hold a uniform clamp load and remain fully tightened.
